alert.note: Alert for DeSoto; Marshall (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 01 at 6:03PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central DeSoto, northwestern Marshall, southwestern Fayette and southeastern Shelby Counties through 630 PM CST... At 603 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Byhalia, or 8 miles southeast of Olive Branch, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Collierville, Olive Branch, Byhalia, Mt Pleasant, Lewisburg, Red Banks, Slayden, Piperton, Rossville, Coal Oil Corner, Cayce, Fairhaven, Elba, Victoria, Cockrum, Watson, Cedarview, Handy Corner, Taska and Miller. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CST for northwestern Mississippi...and west Tennessee.
